author: Sarah Mitchell
excerpt: Tesla shares rose 6% after announcing a new version of its Full Self-Driving software for global markets.
content:
Tesla’s stock rallied after CEO Elon Musk revealed the latest update to the Full Self-Driving software, which promises improved safety and enhanced navigation. Investors responded positively to the announcement, seeing it as a key milestone for the company’s long-term mobility strategy.

Analysts expect the update to drive adoption in Europe and Asia, where regulators are beginning to approve autonomous features. Still, questions around liability and safety oversight persist.

title: Apple Hits $4 Trillion Market Cap Amid AI Expansion
author: James O'Connor
excerpt: Apple became the first company to hit a $4 trillion market cap, driven by AI-powered product launches.
content:
Apple Inc. crossed a historic milestone, becoming the first publicly traded company to achieve a $4 trillion valuation. The rally was supported by strong sales of its AI-enhanced devices and cloud-based services. Wall Street analysts credited Apple’s aggressive expansion into AI productivity tools as a major growth driver.

Investors also praised the firm’s ability to maintain robust profit margins despite global competition.

title: U.S. Inflation Slows to 2.6% in August, Easing Fed Pressure
author: Laura Greene
excerpt: The latest CPI report showed inflation slowed to 2.6% year-over-year, boosting hopes of Fed rate cuts.
content:
The U.S. consumer price index rose 2.6% in August, marking the lowest level in over three years. Core inflation also trended lower, strengthening the case for the Federal Reserve to begin gradual rate cuts in Q4 2025. Market participants welcomed the news, with bond yields falling and equities climbing.

However, Fed officials remain cautious, signaling they need sustained evidence before confirming a pivot in monetary policy.

title: China Unveils $800 Billion Stimulus to Revive Growth
author: David Wong
excerpt: China announced a sweeping $800 billion infrastructure plan to revive slowing economic growth.
content:
Beijing unveiled a massive $800 billion stimulus package aimed at infrastructure, green energy, and technology projects. Officials said the plan will create millions of jobs and stabilize domestic demand. Economists view this as China’s most aggressive effort since the pandemic to counter slowing exports and weak property markets.

Global markets responded with optimism, though concerns about debt sustainability persist.

title: Oil Prices Climb Above $95 on Supply Concerns
author: Anna Rodriguez
excerpt: Global oil prices rose to over $95 per barrel as OPEC+ supply restrictions weighed on the market.
content:
Oil prices gained as supply concerns intensified following reports that OPEC+ will extend production cuts into 2026. Brent crude traded above $95, its highest level in 18 months. Traders warned that further geopolitical tensions in the Middle East could push prices above $100.

Analysts said higher energy costs may reignite inflationary pressures in developed economies, complicating central banks’ policy decisions.

title: Gold Hits Record $2,600 as Asian Demand Surges
author: Robert Hayes
excerpt: Gold prices reached $2,600 per ounce, driven by strong demand from Asia and central bank purchases.
content:
Gold climbed to an all-time high of $2,600 as Asian consumers increased purchases ahead of festive seasons. Central banks also boosted reserves, citing economic uncertainty and currency volatility. Analysts said the metal’s safe-haven appeal remains intact, with investors diversifying away from fiat assets.

However, some market strategists warned of potential corrections if inflation continues to decline globally.

title: Nasdaq Futures Rise as Tech Momentum Builds
author: Karen Lopez
excerpt: U.S. futures gained, led by Nasdaq contracts, as investors piled into tech after strong earnings.
content:
Nasdaq futures rose sharply, supported by strong earnings from chipmakers and software firms. Traders said investor appetite for growth names remains resilient, particularly as inflation cools and the Fed prepares to ease policy. The S&P 500 and Dow futures also ticked higher, but tech stocks clearly dominated sentiment.

Analysts expect momentum to continue if economic data remains supportive.

title: European Stocks Climb as ECB Signals Policy Flexibility
author: Thomas Müller
excerpt: European markets advanced after ECB officials hinted at flexibility in upcoming policy decisions.
content:
European stock indices closed higher after ECB policymakers suggested a more flexible approach to interest rates. Investors interpreted the comments as a sign that the central bank is ready to adapt to evolving economic conditions. Banking and energy stocks led gains, while technology shares also participated in the rally.

Traders said the market is now looking ahead to September’s policy meeting for clearer guidance.

title: Gumi’s Crypto Gains Drive Profit Despite Mobile Gaming Slump
author: Antony Frend
excerpt: Tokyo, Japan – September 15, 2025 – Japanese mobile game studio Gumi Inc.
content:
Tokyo, Japan – September 15, 2025 – Japanese mobile game studio Gumi Inc. reported a surprising turnaround in its first-quarter results, with cryptocurrency investments offsetting a sharp decline in its core gaming revenues. 🚀 Strong Boost from Bitcoin and XRP.

Quarterly sales dropped 52.5% year-on-year to $9.2 million (1.35 billion yen). Yet the bottom line told a different story: operating income edged up to $491,000, ordinary profit surged 371% to $8.3 million, and net income reached $8.4 million — a sharp reversal from the $1.13 million loss recorded a year earlier.

The improvement came largely from Gumi’s crypto portfolio. Over the past six months, the company invested about $6.7 million (1 billion yen) in Bitcoin and recently confirmed plans to purchase $17 million in XRP. Using mark-to-market accounting, these holdings generated $7.4 million in non-operating income, helping to offset weakness in its main business lines.

Executives emphasized that blockchain-related initiatives will continue to play a central role in sustaining profitability in the coming quarters. 🎮 Mobile Gaming Business Contracts Sharply. By contrast, Gumi’s flagship mobile gaming division faced a steep downturn.

Revenue in the segment fell 66.5% to $4.7 million as the company shut down unprofitable titles, handed over some operations to external partners, and sold subsidiary Alim. This led to an operating loss of $630,000, compared with a profit in the same period last year.

Looking ahead, management signaled a stronger focus on developing games based on third-party IP rather than original titles. A full-year earnings forecast was withheld due to market uncertainty. 🔗 Blockchain Becomes Growth Engine. While gaming faltered, blockchain activities offered fresh momentum.

Revenue rose with the launch of “Phantom of Kill—Alternative Imitation,” the debut release under Gumi’s OSHI3 fan-engagement project. Additional income also came from cryptocurrencies earned through blockchain operations. The company said it will continue scaling up blockchain ventures, positioning them as a strategic buffer against the headwinds facing its traditional gaming arm.
